msItem.title: Life of St Wulfstan
msItem.incipit:
Vor þulke þat þe kyng to truste failed he wel uaste
So þat he was bineþe icaste & ouercome ace laste
msItem.explicit:
Vor him me may al day þere mony vair miracle ise
Nou god leue þat we mote wiþ him in þe Ioie of heuene be

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Fabian and Sebastian
msItem.incipit:
SEint fabian bi olde dawe good mon was Inouȝ
At rome he ladde holi lif & to alle godnesse drouȝ
msItem.explicit:
Wende to þe Ioie of heuene þat last wiþoute ende
Nou god uor þe loue of him ous alle þus sende

msItem.title: Life of St Agnes
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Anneis þe holi maide wel ȝong heo bigan
To serui god al miȝti to be cristenwomman
msItem.explicit:
þis was lo a uair myracle of seynt Anneis iwis
Nou god ous bringe to þulke Ioie þat þis maide Inne is

msItem.title: Life of St Vincent
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Vyncent in spayne was & to acristene biscop com
þat men clupede valleri & nom of him cristendom
msItem.explicit:
Nou Ihesu uor þe loue of him lete ous such lif lede
þat we mote to heuene come & for ȝeue ous oure mysdede

msItem.title: Life of St Julian the Confessor
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Iulian þe confessour ibore was at rome
Mony men þoruȝ is prechynge to cristendom come
msItem.explicit:
Anoþer seynt Iulian þare is þat men bidteth to uaste
After good In in strange stude wen hii beþ þer of agaste

msItem.title: Life of St Julian Hosteler
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Iulian þe gode herbiour of noble kunne com
Stallward mon & noble he was & louede cristendom
msItem.explicit:
& atelaste þour godes wille þat we mote fle
To þe Ioie of heuene & wiþþoute ende þer be

msItem.title: Life of St Bridget (longer version)
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Bride þe holi maide of hirlonde was
Biȝute heo was in spouse bruche in awonder cas
msItem.explicit:
þe uerst day of feuerer hire lif heo broȝte to ende
God let ous alle for hir loue to þe Ioie of heuene wende

msItem.title: Life of St Blase
msItem.incipit:
SEint Blase wel clene lif ladde wiþþoute hore
In þe lond of capadose þis godemon was ibore
msItem.explicit:
Nou god leue þat we parti mote of þe heie blisse
þat seint blase is Inne ibroȝe þat we þer of ne misse

msItem.title: Life of St Agatha
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Agace þe gode maide in cisile was ibore
Wel ȝong cristene heo bicom & forsok sunne & hore
msItem.explicit:
As wisliche bidde we hire as heo þe contreie ȝef bote
þat we to te Ioie of heuene wiþ hire come mote

msItem.title: Life of St Scholastica
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Scolace þe holi maide holi was of lyue
Leuere heo hadde nonne be þen be iwedded to wyue
msItem.explicit:
So god leue þat we mote wiþ cristenemen be
Ibured at our ende day & to heuene fle

msItem.title: Life of St Valentine
msItem.incipit:
SEyn valentyn þe martir good man was Inouȝ
& þoru is prechyng mony mon to cristendom drouȝ
msItem.explicit:
& is soule to heuene wende þoru godes grace
Nou god uor þe loue of him ous bringe to þulke place

msItem.title: Life of St Juliana
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Iulian þe gode herbiour of noble kunne com
Stallward mon & noble he was & louede cristendom
msItem.explicit:
& atelaste þour godes wille þat we mote fle
To þe Ioie of heuene & wiþþoute ende þer be

msItem.title: Life of St Matthias
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Mathi apostel is as ȝe scholleþ iwite
þeru lot apostel ymad he was as we fyndeþ iwrite
msItem.explicit:
& burede it þus wiþ gret honur as me sceweþ ȝute
In seynt marie chirche ofte his heued wit gret prute

msItem.title: Life of St Oswald the Bishop
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Oswald þe biscop was ibore her in engelonde
Of heie men he was icome as ic vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
Vor is loue our lord haþ þer vair myracle ofte iwroȝt
God lete ous to þe Ioie come þat he is Inne ibroȝt

msItem.title: Life of St Chad
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Chadde þe holi mon was of engelonde
Biscop he was of lichesfeld as ic vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
& wiþ angles to heuene wende as hi broȝte him er tydynge
Nou god uor þe loue of him to þulke Ioie ous bringe

msItem.title: Life of St Gregory
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Gregori þe confessour in cicile was ibore
In holinesse he ladde is lif þat is soule nere uorlore
msItem.explicit:
Bidde we him wiþ gode herte apostel of engelonde
þat he byuore our lord crist our neode vnderstonde

msItem.title: Life of St Patrick (with his Purgatory)
msItem.incipit:
SEyn patric com þoru godes grace to preci in irlonde
To teche men hor riȝte bileue on Ihesu to vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
Beteþ alle ȝoure sunne her as god wole ȝou grace sende
þat we wiþþoute oþer pyne to parais henne wende

msItem.title: Life of St Edward the Elder
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Edward þe ȝonge martir was kyng of engelonde
Wel ȝong ymartred he was þoru trecherie & onde
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor þeloue of boþe þat our kynges were
To þe Ioie of heuene þat hi beþ Inne wiþ hem bringe ous þere

msItem.title: Life of St Cuthbert
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Cubert was ibore her in engelonde
God dude uor him uair miracle as ȝe scolle vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
& to þe Ioie of heuene god let ous ek also
& þoru þe bone of seynt Cutbert bringe ous alle þerto

msItem.title: Life of St Benedict
msItem.incipit:
SEyn benet was ibore in þe lond of mursie
To rome he was wel ȝong isend to lerny of clergie
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor þe loue of seynt benet ous lete þen wei wende
& to þe Ioie þat he is Inne to him come aten ende

msItem.title: The Feast of the Annunciation
msItem.incipit:
SEynte Marie dai in leynte among oþer dawes gode
Riȝt is uorteholde hei hoso him vnderstode
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we Ihesu godes sone þat þulke heie dai wroȝte
þat we mote come to þulke Ioie þat he ous to boȝte

msItem.incipit:
FEsten meble þer beþ icleped viue in þe ȝere
þe uerste is to louke aleluye our penaunce to rere
msItem.explicit:
þat we scholde wiþ sorwe of herte our penaunce lede
& aȝen þe tyme of leynte repenty our mysdede

msItem.incipit:
LEynte comeþ þer afterward þat six wuke ilasteþ
& hor sunnen uorte beten alle cristenmen uasteþ
msItem.explicit:
So þat he mowe an ester dai wen he haþ al iuast
Our lordes flesc vnderuonge þat aswete mossel is last

msItem.incipit:
ÞE holi feste of ester comeþ after leynte anon
As our lord aros fram deþe to lyue boþe in flesc & bon
msItem.explicit:
þe rouisous ne comeþ neuere biuore seynt Markes dai
þer uore we wolleþ of telle in þe bigynnyng of may

msItem.title: Life of St Mary of Egypt
msItem.incipit:
SEynte Marie egipciake in egipte was ibore
All hire ȝonge lif heo ladde In sunne & in hore
msItem.explicit:
þus seynt marie Egipciake out of hire fol dede
Turnde to heuene blisse þoru penaunce þat heo gan lede

msItem.title: Life of St Alphege
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Alfe þe martir þat good mon was Inouȝ
Ibore was in engelond & to holi lif drouȝ
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we seynt Alfe þat broȝte þer is lif to ende
þat we mote þoru is bone to þe Ioie of heuene wende

msItem.title: Life of St George
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Iorge þe holi mon as we fyndeþ iwrite
In þe lond of capadoce ibore was & biȝitte
msItem.explicit:
þer he is in grete Ioie þat last wiþþouten ende
Nou god uor þe loue of him ous let alle þuder wende

msItem.title: Life of St Mark
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Marc þe holi gospellare wide wende alonde
Vorto preche cristendom þoruȝ our lordes sonde
msItem.explicit:
& for feste of þe letanye þat byuore may
Holi chirche halt ech ȝer a seyn Markes day

msItem.title: Letania maior et minor
msItem.incipit:
LEtanye is asong as ȝe mowe ofte ise
To bidde ech halwe after oþer our help uorte be
msItem.explicit:
Vor it nys no neode wenne hi beþ þer to sette hem here also
Vor sette hem here & ek þer it nere noȝt wel ido

msItem.title: Life of St Peter
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Peres þe frere prechour In þe cite of beronye
Ibore was of mysbilievned men þat were al in eresie
msItem.explicit:
At þe endyng of aueryl he þolede Martirdom
God ous bringe to þulke Ioie þat his soule to com

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Philip and James

msItem.incipit:
SEyn Pelip & seynt Iacob apostles tweie
þe uerste day þat comeþ in may deþ hi þolede beie

msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we ȝerne seynt Iacob & seynt Pelip also
þat oure soule mote uorþ wiþ hore in to þe Ioie of heuene be ido

msItem.title: The ‘Early History’ of the Cross
msItem.incipit:
þE holi rode þe swete tre riȝt is to habbe in munde
þat haþ fram stronge deþ ibroȝt to lyue al mankunde
msItem.explicit:
So þat þulke stude was vorlete mony aday
þat no cristenmon ne paynym muste war þe rode lay

msItem.title: The Invention of the Cross
msItem.incipit:
A noble emperour þus com seþþe þat het constantyn
In batail he was so muche þat þus nas of no fyn
msItem.explicit:
Quiriac þonkede oure lord crist wiþ gret Ioie he is nom
& tok hem eleyne þe gode quene þo he to hire com

msItem.title: The ‘Exaltation’ of the Cross
msItem.rubric: þe holy Rod in May kynge Cosdre
msItem.incipit:
þE holi rode was ifounde as ȝe witeþ in may
& an haused was in septembre þe holi rode day
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor loue of þe suete rode þat þu were on ido
Bryng ous to þe heie Ioie þat þu boȝtest ous to

msItem.title: Life of St Quiriac
msItem.incipit:
SEyn quiriac þat biscop was prechede godes lawe
Iulian þe luþer emperour broȝte him of lif dawe
msItem.explicit:
& is soule to heuene wende after þis tormentynge
God uor þe loue of seynt quiriac to þulke Ioie ous bringe

msItem.title: Life of St Brendan
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Brendan þe holi mon was of Irlonde
Monek he was of harde lyue as ic vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
An albei þus was seþþe arered as is bodi was ido
Nou god ous bringe to þulke Ioie as is soule wende to

msItem.title: Life of St Dunstan
msItem.incipit:
SEyn dunston was of engelond icome of gode more
Miracle our lord dude uor him ar he were ibore
msItem.explicit:
Swete lord seynt dunston þat oure erchebiscop were
Bryng ous to þe Ioie of heuene as angles þi soule bere

msItem.title: Life of St Aldhelm
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Aldelm þe confessour was man of noble lyue
Ibore he was in engelond þe kynges broþer sone Iue
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we ȝerne seynt aldelm þat he our erande bere so
þat we mote to þe Ioie come þat he is on ido

msItem.title: Life of St Augustine of Canterbury
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Austyn þat cristendom broȝte in to engelonde
Riȝt is among oþer iwis þat be vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we ȝerne seynt Austyn þat to crisendom ous brouȝte
þat we mote to þe Ioie come to wam our lord ous boȝte

msItem.title: Life of St Barnabas
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Barnabe þe apostel þat good was & hende
Imartred he was uor godes loue in strong deþ aten ende
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we ȝerne ihesu crist kyng of alle kynge
Vor þe loue of Barnabe þat he ous to heuene bringe

msItem.title: Life of St John the Baptist
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Ion was þe beste bern þe holi baptist
þat of womman was ibore euere saue ihesu crist
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt Ion þat in flum Iordan baptised godes sone
Let ous þoru our cristendom to þe Ioie of heuene come

msItem.title: Life of St Peter
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Peter was wiþ our lord of alle apostles hext
Seynt Ion þe ewangelist & he our lord were euer next
msItem.explicit:
Seynt Peter þat bereþ heuene keie þoru our lordes grace
Graunte ous þuder come & þer Inne habbe an place

msItem.title: Life of St Paul
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Poul was aluþer mon ar he conuerted were
Alle cristenmen of þelond hadde of him gret fere
msItem.explicit:
& uor loue of seynt poul was lif ichabbe ised
Bring ous to þe Ioie of heuene after þat we beþ ded

msItem.title: Life of St Swithin
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Swiþin þe confessour was of engelonde
Bi side wynchestre he was ibore as ic vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt swiþin þat our biscop was her in engelonde
Bringe ous to þe Ioie of heuene þoru our lordes sonde

msItem.title: Life of St Kenelm
msItem.incipit:
Sein kenelm þe ȝonge kyng þat holi martir is
Kyng he was of engelond of þe marche of walis
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor seynt kenelms loue is swete grace us sende
þat we mote to þulke Ioie þat he is Inne wende

msItem.title: Life of St Margaret
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Margarete was holi maide & good
Ibore heo was in antioch Icome of kunde blod
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt Margarete þat holi maide we biddeþ aten ende
þat þu bidde uor ous þat we mote to þe Ioie of heuene wende

msItem.title: Life of St Mary Magdalene
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Marie magdaleyn þat god uor ȝef hire sunne
Lazare soster & martha In come of kynges kunne
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt Marie Magdaleyn þat broȝte hire lif þus to ende
Bidde god þat we mote wiþ hire to þe Ioie of heuene wende

msItem.title: Life of St Christina
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Cristine þe holi þing as ic ȝou telle con
Holi lif ladde & clene & wel ȝou telle con
msItem.explicit:
Wiþ torment as ȝe haweþ ihurd & eiþ wounder monion
Nou god uor þe loue of hir ous bringe þuder echon

msItem.title: Life of St James the Great
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Iame þe apostel riȝt is to habbe In mone
Seynt Iones broþer þe euangelist & godes aunte sone
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt Iame uor þe holi stude þat þu hast in galis
Help ous & alle þine pilgrims & bring ous to heuene blis

msItem.title: Life of St Christopher
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Cristofere was sarazyn In þe lond of canaan
In none stude bi is daie ne bond me so strong aman
msItem.explicit:
þus seynt cristofere atelaste þe herte lord out soȝte
Nou god ous bringe to þulke Ioie þat he is soule broȝte

msItem.title: Legend of the Seven Sleepers
msItem.incipit:
Seue sleparis were holi men as me haþ itold biuore
In þe site of ephese hi were alle ibore
msItem.explicit:
Nou god þat In þulke holi men so vair miracle sende
Bringe ous to þulke Ioie þat hor soule to wende

msItem.title: Life of St Lawrence
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Laurance good mon was & In strong martirdom
He endede anerþe is lif & to þe Ioie of heuene com
msItem.explicit:
Nou ihesus uor þe grete pine þat seynt laurence uor þe hadde
Bring ous to þulke Ioie þat þin angles him to ladde

msItem.title: Life of St Hippolytus
msItem.incipit:
Seyn Ipolit þe martir knyȝt was of gret honur
þat seynt laurence In person wuste þoru heste of þe emperour
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we ȝerne seynt Ipolit þat he our erande bede
þat god habbe mercy of ous & of alle þat habbeþ nede

msItem.title: The Assumption of Our Lady
msItem.incipit:
SEynte marie godes moder fram þe apostles nas noȝt
þo þe holi gost awitsoneday among hem was ibroȝt
msItem.explicit:
So þat heo was of sixti ȝer ar heo were henne Inome
Nou god ous grante uorþ wiþ hire to þe Ioie of heuene come

msItem.title: Life of St Bartholomew
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Berthelmeu þe apostel com of kynges blode
Sinþe uair man & noble he was of glad & suete mode
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we ȝerne seynt berthelmeu þat hei apostel is
þat þe raþer þoru is bone come to heuene blis

msItem.title: Life of St Giles
msItem.incipit:
Seyn gilis þe holi mon ne louede noþing sunne
At atteneis he was ibore he com of kynges kunne
msItem.explicit:
He deide seue hondred ȝer after þat god was ibore
& wende to þe Ioie of heuene þat he of seruede byuore

msItem.title: Life of St Matthew
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Matheu þe euangelist apostel he was iwis
Euangelist & eke apostel boþe he was & is
msItem.explicit:
Nou ihesus ȝeue ous grace þulke Ioie to wynne
Vor þe loue of seynt matheu þat is soule is Inne

msItem.title: Life of St Justina
msItem.incipit:
Seyn Iustine of heie men In antioch com
Wel ȝong heo louede on ihesu crist & turnde to cristendom
msItem.explicit:
Nou Ihesu uor þe suete loue of þe maide Iustine
& vor þe loue of ciprian schulde ous fram helle pyne

msItem.title: Legend of St Michael
msItem.incipit:
Seyn Michel þe archangel & is felawes also
Beþ bituene god & ous to scewe wat we schulle do
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor þe loue of seynt Michel ous let such lif lede
þat we mote to heuene come after þat we beþ dede

msItem.title: Life of St Jerome
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Ierom was swiþe good clerc & wis In alle þinge
Much he made of godes seruice þat men in chirch doþ singe
msItem.explicit:
þer Inne him burede is monekes þis was is lyues ende
Nou god ous bringe to þilke ioie þat is soule gan to wemde

msItem.title: Life of St Leger
msItem.incipit:
SEyn liger þat biscop was & holi mon Inouȝ
þoru is prechinge monion to our lord he dronȝ
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor loue of seynt liger is suete grace ous sende
þat we after þisse lyue to þe Ioie of heuene wende

msItem.title: Life of St Francis
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Frances þe frere menour good mon was Inouȝ
In is ȝonghede marchaunt he was & to trewenesse dron
msItem.explicit:
& beþ þer boþe two In Ioie wiþþoute ende
Nou god uor loue of hem ous late þuder wende

msItem.title: Life of St Faith
msItem.incipit:
SEynte fei þe holi maide of suyþe heie men com
Swiþe ȝong In hire child hod heo turnde to cristendom
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt Fei & hire felawes our ernde beode so
þat we mote to þe Ioie come þat hi beþ Inne ido

msItem.title: Life of St Denis
msItem.incipit:
SEyn denys was In þe olde lawe payn as oþer were
In þe cite of atteneis þer non oþer nere
msItem.explicit:
þer hi beȝut alle þre as monymen iseþ
God ȝeue ous part of þulke Ioie þat hi Inne beþ

msItem.title: Legend of St Michael
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Michel In nouembre haþ ek anoþer day
Biuore þe feste of seynt Luc as ic ȝou telle may
msItem.explicit:
Vor þei hi out of helle be hi ne schulleþ so at route
þat hi þe bernynges of helle wiþ hem ne bereþ aboute

msItem.title: Life of St Luke
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Luc þe euangelist non apostel nas
Ac þe apostles he siwede & hor diciple was
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we seynt Ion & seynt Luc & hor felawes beie
þat hi bringe ous toward heuene In þe riȝte weie

msItem.title: Life of St Frideswitha
msItem.incipit:
SEynte ffredeswide was her of engelonde
At oxenford heo was ibore as ic vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
þer haþ ibe uor hire loue ofte gret bonynge
Nou bidde we god uor hire loue þat he to heuene ous bringe

msItem.title: The Eleven Thousand Virgins
msItem.incipit:
Elleue þousend virgines þat vair companye was
Imartred were uor godes loue ichulle ȝou telle þat cas
msItem.explicit:
Nou god ous grante uor is grace þat we mote winne
þe heie Ioie of heuene þat þis maidens beþ Inne

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Simon and Jude
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Symon & seynt Iude twei breþeren were
Marie sones cleophe as oure bokes ous doþ lere
msItem.explicit:
þer seynt Symon & seynt Iude þe holi apostles tweie
Endede hor lif in martirdom & to heuene wende beie

msItem.title: Life of St Quintin
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Quintyn þe martyr of þe contreie was of rome
Vor godes loue he þolede much as he to heuene come
msItem.explicit:
Hi seie heuene openy þet aȝen In heo flei anon
Nou god uor þe loue of seynt qiutyne ous bringe þuder echon

msItem.title: Life of St Alban
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Albon þe holi mon was her of engelonde
Imartred he was uor godes loue þoru our lordes sonde
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we ȝerne seynt albon & ihesu crist wel uaste
þat we mote to þe Ioie come þat euer schal laste

msItem.title: All Saints Day
msItem.incipit:
Alle halwen day we holdeþ one tyme of þe ȝere
Vor uale enchesons holi chirch þerto ous gan lere
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we alle halwen to holde hor feste so
þat hi bringe ous to þulke Ioie þat hi beþ Inne Ido

msItem.title: All Souls’ Day
msItem.incipit:
Alle soulen dai anerþe riȝt is to holde heie
Vor alle we sculle habbe neode þerto & alle schulle deie
msItem.explicit:
Nou ihesus þat ous dere boȝte þei we do ofte amys
Of oure soule haue mercy & bringe ous to heuene blis

msItem.title: Life of St Eustace
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Eustas a noble knyȝt of heþene lawe was
Ac ar he were icristned men clupede him placidas
msItem.explicit:
Ipassed it was an hondred ȝer & twenti after þat god her com
þat eustas myd is wif & is sones þolede martirdom

msItem.title: Life of St Leonard
msItem.incipit:
Sayn leonard þe confessour alonde eode her
After þat god anerþe com aboute vif hondred ȝere
msItem.explicit:
Þe miracles þt he persones dude ne mai no tonge telle
Nou god schulde ous poru seint leonard fram prison of helle

msItem.title: Life of St Martin
msItem.incipit:
SEyn martin was ibore In þe lond of sabarie
Wel longe he was Inorised In þe lond of papie
msItem.explicit:
Vour score wynter he was old ar he deide also
Nou god ous ȝeue part of þulke Ioie þat is soule wende to

msItem.title: Life of St Brice
msItem.incipit:
SEyn brice wiþ seynt martin was is dekene anerþe here
To seynt martyn he was contrarious In eche manere
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor þe gret a[ ] þat seynt brice hadde here
Grante ous to be vor is loue of pyne of helle skere

msItem.title: Life of St Edmund, Archbishop of Canterbury
msItem.incipit:
SEyn edmond þe confessour þet liþ at pounteneie
Of godemen & trewe com þei hi were noȝt wel heie
msItem.explicit:
Nou uor is loue we biddeþ god þat ous dere aboȝte
Bringe ous to þe heie blisse þat is soule to broȝte

msItem.title: Life of St Edmund the King
msItem.incipit:
SEyn edmond þe kyng of wan we makeþ feste
Of þe on ende of engelond kyng was bi este
msItem.explicit:
Nou god uor þe loue of seynt edmond þat was so noble kyng
Grante ous þe Ioie þat he is Inne after our endyng

msItem.title: Life of St Cecilia
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Cecile of noble kunne ibore was at rome
Our lord crist heo louede wel ar heo fram cradel come
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we our suete lord uor hire holi martirdom
To bringe ous to þulke Ioie þat hire soule to com

msItem.title: Life of St Clement
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Clement was ibore at rome bi olde dawe
Of þe hexte men he com at rome þat were of þulke lawe
msItem.explicit:
þer is nou seynt clements chirch I mad wiþ qinte gynne
God ȝeue vs part of þulke Ioie þat is soule is Inne

msItem.title: Life of St Katharine of Alexandria
msItem.incipit:
SEynte katerine of noble kunne com bi olde dawe
Hire fader kyng hire moder quene boþe of olde lawe
msItem.explicit:
Nou ihesu crist vor þe suete loue of seynt katerine
ȝeue ous þe Ioie of heuene & schulde ous fram helle pyne

msItem.title: Life of St Andrew
msItem.incipit:
Seynt Andreu þe apostel was seynt Peters broþer
Our lord sulf to cristendom him broȝte & non oþer
msItem.explicit:
Nou bidde we seynt Andreu þat he ous so wisse
& bidde uor ous þat we come to heuene blisse

msItem.title: Life of St Nicholas
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Nycholas þe holi mon þat good confessour was
Icome he was of heie men In þe cite of patras
msItem.explicit:
Nou god þat for seynt Nichol such myracle hast ido
Schulde ous fram þe pyne of helle & fram dedlich sunne also

msItem.title: The Conception of Mary and the Expanded Nativity

msItem.incipit:
Of Ioie & blisse is al my song kare to bileue
to herie him among þat al our sorwe schal reue
msItem.explicit:
þat swete bern our kunde boþe of flesch & felle
Of þe kunde of wan we come somwat ic mot telle

msItem.incipit:
A good mon þat men clupede isacar was bi olde dawe
In bedlehem þat doȝtren hadde two In þe olde lawe
msItem.explicit:
Ac naþeles þer wiþþoute me mai ifynde some
Ac ȝif god wole hi mowe amende ar hi to deþe come

msItem.title: Life of St Lucy
msItem.incipit:
SEynte Lucie þat holi maide in cicile was ibore
Wel ȝong heo gan to seruy god & bileue sunne & hore
msItem.explicit:
þer heo is wiþ ihesu crist In Ioie wiþþouten ende
Nou god for þe loue of hire ous lete þuder wende

msItem.title: Life of St Thomas the Apostle
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Thomas þe gode apostel Imartred was in Inde
Of is lif we mote rede as we doþ In bok fynde
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt Thomas þat In to Inde cristendom verst broȝte
Bringe ous to þe Ioie of heuene to wan our lord os boȝte

msItem.incipit:
SEyn Anastace was ibore at rome bi olde dawe
Of swiþe heie men icome al of þe olde lawe
msItem.explicit:
& þe maner is to muche anerþe to lye lesinge
To þe Ioie of heuene þat heo is Inne godes ous bringe

msItem.title: Life of St Stephen
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Steuene was a wgiw & of giwes he com
þoru prechinge of þe apostles he turnde to cristendom
msItem.explicit:
In þulke chirch his holi bones were ido in scryne
Nou god for þe loue of seynt steuene vs saue fram helle pyne

msItem.title: Life of St John the Evangelist
msItem.incipit:
SEyn Ion þe euengelist þat apostel also is
His moder was our leuedi soster & seynt Iames broþer iwis
msItem.explicit:
Of ech halwe men fynd to soþe þat bodi bileuei here
Bote of our leuedi & seynt Ion þat maidens were so clere

msItem.title: Life of St Oswald the King
msItem.incipit:
SEynt Oswold þe holi kyng of þe on ende of engelonde
Kyng was as vel þulke tyme of norþhomblonde
msItem.explicit:
Nou seynt oswold þe martir so our ernde bede
þat god ous sende is swete help & alle þat halbe nede

msItem.title: Life of St Thomas of Canterbury
msItem.incipit:
ENgelond glad þu beo vor þu miȝt wel eþe
&al holi chirche also for one monnes deþe
msItem.explicit:
þei hi beo wel repentaunt as þis knyȝtes were ic wene
ȝut ne libbeþ hi niȝt half hor lif as hit was bi hem isene

msItem.title: The Translation of St Thomas of Canterbury
msItem.incipit:
Seynt Thomas þis holi mon vnder erþe lai
Ar he ischrined were mony along dai
msItem.explicit:
Nou ihesu for þe swete loue þat seynt Thomas on þoȝte
Bringe ous to þulke Ioie þat he so dere abouȝte

msItem.title: Life of St Edward the Confessor
msItem.incipit:
SEyn edward þe gode kyng riȝt is to habbe in munde
Ibore he was in engelond Ichulle segge of wuch kunde
msItem.explicit:
So þat non ne deude þer of after him desturbinge
þe chirch he let halwy as [ ]childermasse dai
msItem.note: The final folios are fragmentary. G.E. Moore, The Middle English Life of Edward the Confessor (Philadephia, 1942), p. iii attempts to reconstruct their contents.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation, superseding an incorrect ink foliation of the 17th century, which starts with 4 and continues up to 259. At this point, the first leaf of the first quire was evidently missing but leaves 2–4 were present.
supportDesc.collation: 112 (1–4 lost, = 11), 2–1312 (= 154), 1410, 15–2212 (= 260), 2312 (1, 2, 7, 8 lost; 9 is in two parts numbered 265–6; = 269). Since 11–4 would have taken up the 288 lines missing, no quire seems to be lost at the beginning and no temporale probably ever preceded the collection. Regular catchwords, often in a red frame; no signatures.

layoutDesc.layout: One column with 36 (fols. 4–22) to 47 (fol. 101r) lines per page. 176 100

handDesc.handNote: Written in a small Anglicana hand by one scribe in brown ink. Görlach (p. 74) suggests that the scribe has attempted to reproduce features of a dignified book hand on the basis of an engrossing hand, with upright and square proportions.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials, flourished in red with marginal extensions at the beginning of each work.
Capital letters dotted or crossed in red. Running titles added in a 15th-century hand.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard with blind tooled edging of double rows. Spine rebacked.

history.origin:
14th century, first quarter
English ; orthography is consistent within the volume, suggesting that these reflect the scribe’s own dialect, analysed as belonging to Gloucestershire (LP 7170).
history.provenance: A 16th-century hand supplies unsuitable rhyme words on fol. 211v. Two other readers of this period add some Latin marginalia, one of whom is likely also responsible for the ink foliation.
John tayllor off Brydstow (fol. 189r); later passed to his descendent:
history.acquisition: Entered the Bodleian Library from the collection of the Ashmolean Museum.

recordHist.source: Description by Andrew Dunning (January 2021), based in part on the Digital Intex of Middle English Verse; and Manfred Görlach, The Textual Tradition of the South English Legendary (Leeds, 1974), pp. 73–5. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (W. H. Black, A descriptive, analytical, and critical catalogue of the manuscripts bequeathed unto the University of Oxford by Elias Ashmole Esq...., Quarto Catalogues X, 1845). Quarto Catalogue, col. 64 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 65–6 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 67–8 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1123

ref.title: MWM: Manuscripts of the West Midlands

revisionDesc.change: Andrew Dunning Revised with consultation of original.
